data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For each step backward you must return to the starting point. The following is a list of steps to be taken forward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Doing one instruction takes four steps. In the alternate instructions, you only take four steps and turn around. If you read right before right, you will usually never turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and go around then take 6 steps to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step. Take 7 steps: 7 steps to return home. Take 1 step. Take 1 step: 4 steps to go home. Go back the same amount: 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

The first sequence from the starting point is 10 steps. So, its no longer necessary to travel back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Let’s say a person is about to turn left and right, he turns around and turn left again. So the answer is Yes.

Turn right twice, and you'll get back.

If you're taking 6 steps in and 1 step back, you can return to the beginning point in 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In each of the first 4 steps, the walker must be facing forward. In the final step, the walker must be facing straight forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point in this method can be found in the diagram below. If you retrace your steps the number of times that you went forward in one circle is 6 + 6. If you retrace your steps the number of times that you went backward in one circle is 9 + 6. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If someone is facing in the direction you want them to go, they should start from the same place as you are going. Take 3 steps forward and one step backward each time. So, the answer is no.

They don't always face forward. They usually don’t take more than 2 steps backward from facing forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

On the sixth step from right, you should take 1 step left. After 3 steps left, you should take 4 steps right. On the nine step from left, you should take 9 steps left. In between all these steps, you should always face forward. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person that always always faces forward must always take 3 steps forward in 2 directions. The only ways to get back to the starting point are take 3 steps forward, take 4 steps left, or take 1 step right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions, you always face forwards. If you face backwards then you take 6 steps left. If you follow the instructions, you always face forwards and take 3 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is on the far side of the building. If you turn around, you are turned around back. If you turn around, you are turned around back. If you take 4 steps to turn around, you take 10 steps. Therefore, the answer is No.

You can only return to an exact location with 2  3 = 6 steps. If you took 10 steps and turned around to take 9 steps, the first sequence doesn’t work. So, the answer is No.

Turning left has 4 steps. Turning right has 7 steps. If you follow the instructions, you take 5 steps. If you change the direction of the step, you will be back at the beginning. So, the answer is No.
